entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Flooding Possible on the Tanana River Starting Monday... Glacial rivers draining the Alaska Range such as the Tanana, Chisana, and Nabesna Rivers are running near bankfull. This is due to hot temperatures causing significant high elevation snow melt in the Alaska Range. Periods of heavy showers over the Southeast Interior today through
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued July 10 at 7:28AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * SURF...Surfs of 10 to 12 feet will continue to impact south and east facing shores due to a large southerly swell and moderate to fresh tradewinds. * TIMING...through the new week. * IMPACTS...strong rip currents and large surfs.

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 12:57PM PDT until July 11 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE TONIGHT TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, will again impact the coast and bayshore this evening through early Sunday night and have historically resulted in the localized flooding of specific low lying areas
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline

entry.summary: ...HOT TEMPERATURES WITH THUNDERSTORM CHANCES THIS WEEK... Expect the hottest temperatures of the year so far to occur this week.
